trans-unit.source: SAML protocol requires the identity provider (Azure Active Directory) and the service provider (the application) to exchange information about themselves.
trans-unit.target: SAML protocol requires the identity provider (Azure Active Directory) and the service provider (the application) to exchange information about themselves.

trans-unit.source: When a service provider is registered with Azure Active Directory, the developer registers federation-related information with Azure Active Directory, including the redirect URI and the metadata URI of the service provider.
trans-unit.target: When a service provider is registered with Azure Active Directory, the developer registers federation-related information with Azure Active Directory, including the redirect URI and the metadata URI of the service provider.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory uses the metadata URI of the cloud service to retrieve the signing key and the logout URI of the cloud service.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory uses the metadata URI of the cloud service to retrieve the signing key and the logout URI of the cloud service.

trans-unit.source: If the service provider does not support a metadata URL, the developer must contact Microsoft support to provide the logout URI and signing key.
trans-unit.target: If the service provider does not support a metadata URL, the developer must contact Microsoft support to provide the logout URI and signing key.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory exposes tenant-specific and common (tenant-independent) single sign-on and single sign-out endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory exposes tenant-specific and common (tenant-independent) single sign-on and single sign-out endpoints.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the endpoints for each type.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the endpoints for each type.

trans-unit.source: The Federation Metadata URLs represent addressable locations -- they are not just an identifiers -- so you can go to the endpoint to read the metadata.
trans-unit.target: The Federation Metadata URLs represent addressable locations -- they are not just an identifiers -- so you can go to the endpoint to read the metadata.

trans-unit.source: The tenant-specific federation metadata is located at the tenant-specific metadata endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The tenant-specific federation metadata is located at the tenant-specific metadata endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The <TenantDomainName> placeholder represents a registered domain name or TenantID GUID of an Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: The <TenantDomainName> placeholder represents a registered domain name or TenantID GUID of an Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: For example, the federation metadata of the <placeholder>contoso.com</placeholder> tenant is at: <codeInline>https://login.microsoftonline.com/<codeFeaturedElement>contoso.com</codeFeaturedElement>/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: For example, the federation metadata of the <placeholder>contoso.com</placeholder> tenant is at: <codeInline>https://login.microsoftonline.com/<codeFeaturedElement>contoso.com</codeFeaturedElement>/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: The common or <newTerm>tenant-independent</newTerm> federation metadata is located at the tenant-independent metadata endpoint: <externalLink><linkText>https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</linkText><linkUri>https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The common or <newTerm>tenant-independent</newTerm> federation metadata is located at the tenant-independent metadata endpoint: <externalLink><linkText>https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</linkText><linkUri>https://login.microsoftonline.com/common/FederationMetadata/2007-06/FederationMetadata.xml</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: You can go to that location to read the tenant-independent metadata.
trans-unit.target: You can go to that location to read the tenant-independent metadata.

trans-unit.source: In this endpoint address, "common" appears, instead of a tenant domain name or ID.
trans-unit.target: In this endpoint address, "common" appears, instead of a tenant domain name or ID.

trans-unit.source: For information about the Federation Metadata documents that Azure Active Directory publishes, see <link xlink:href="ee6193d7-1194-482a-a97c-51df5e31f458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Federation Metadata</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the Federation Metadata documents that Azure Active Directory publishes, see <link xlink:href="ee6193d7-1194-482a-a97c-51df5e31f458" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Federation Metadata</link>.
